Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lidless lekanis with part of horizontal reflex handle; much of glaze fired orange-brown; interior glazed with broad added red band; on top of rim, double dot band; exterior: at rim, broad glaze band; below, black-figure decoration consisting of part of sphinx (only hindquarters missing) to right; incised fat rosette and blobs as filling ornament; below; band above tips of rays at foot.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
According to Möller, the Polos Painter and his circle were active from c. 585-550 BC and she therefore dates the sherd to this time period.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 335, no. B394)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 226, no. 3) (bottom of page)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0762) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 91, pl. 1, no. 18)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
